saberes: - Self-confidence in the use of the foreign language...
- Initiation to basic strategies for comprehension and production of short, simple and contextualised oral, written and multimodal texts

- elementary communicative functions appropriate to the domain and context: greeting, saying goodbye, introducing oneself and others; identifying characteristics of people, objects and places; answering concrete questions on everyday matters; expressing time, quantity and space..
- Elementary contextual models in the comprehension and production of short, simple oral, written and multimodal texts such as greetings, notes, lists or notices

- Elementary linguistic units and meanings associated with these structures such as expression of the entity and its properties, quantity and number, affirmation, exclamation, negation, interrogation and exhortation
- Elementary vocabulary and vocabulary of interest to learners relating to basic interpersonal relationships, housing, places and immediate surroundings...
- Initiation to elementary sound and accent patterns..

- Elementary conversational conventions and strategies, in synchronous or asynchronous format, for initiating, maintaining and terminating communication, taking and giving the floor, asking and answering questions, etc..
- Elementary analogue and digital tools for oral, written and multimodal comprehension and production

- Elementary strategies and techniques for detecting communicative deficiencies and limitations arising from the level of competence in the foreign language and in the other languages of one's own linguistic repertoire

- Initiation in elementary strategies for identifying and using linguistic units (lexis, morphosyntax, sound patterns, etc.) on the basis of a comparison of the languages and varieties which make up one's own linguistic repertoire
-Foreign language as a means of communication and interaction with people from other countries
- Elementary and most significant sociocultural and sociolinguistic aspects related to customs and everyday life in countries where the foreign language is spoken..
- Initiation in basic strategies for understanding and appreciating linguistic, cultural and artistic diversity, based on eco-social and democratic values...
- Initiation in basic strategies for detecting discriminatory uses of verbal and non-verbal language.
criteriosEvaluacion: 1.1. Recognise and understand common words and expressions in short, very simple oral, written and multimodal texts on frequent, everyday topics of personal relevance and close to their own experience, expressed in a comprehensible, clear, simple and direct way, and in standard language

1.2. Select in a guided way elementary strategies to understand the overall idea and specific elements of short, simple messages in everyday communicative situations of relevance to the learner in order to grasp the overall meaning and identify specific elements with the help of linguistic and non-linguistic elements of the context

2.1. Orally express short, simple sentences containing basic information on everyday matters of relevance to the learner, using verbal and non-verbal resources in a guided way, using previously presented models and structures and reproducing as far as possible the rhythm, stress and intonation of the foreign language...

2.2. Write words, familiar expressions and phrases from models and for a specific purpose, using analogue and digital tools, using grammatical structures and elementary lexis on everyday matters of personal relevance to the learner

2.3. Select in a guided way elementary strategies to produce short and simple messages appropriate to the communicative intentions using, with help, physical or digital resources and supports according to the needs of each context...

3.1. Participate in a guided way in elementary interactive situations on everyday topics, previously prepared, through different media, using resources such as repetition, slow pace or non-verbal language, and showing empathy...

3.2. Select in a guided way and in familiar surroundings, elementary strategies for greeting, saying goodbye and introducing oneself; express simple and brief messages; and formulate and answer basic questions for communication

4.1. Interpret and explain, in a guided way, basic information of concepts, communications and short and simple texts in situations in which they attend to diversity, showing empathy and interest for the interlocutors and for the problems of understanding in their immediate environment, relying on different resources and supports

4.2. Select and apply, in a very guided way, elementary strategies that help to build bridges and facilitate the understanding and production of information, as well as fluent communication, using, with help, physical or digital resources and supports according to the needs of each context...
5.1. Understand that there are obvious similarities and differences between different languages, reflecting, in a guided way, on elementary aspects of their functioning

5.2. Identify and differentiate, in a guided manner, knowledge and strategies for improving their ability to communicate and learn the foreign language, with the support of other participants and of analogue and digital media
5.3. Identify and explain, in a guided manner, elementary progress and difficulties in the foreign language learning process...

6.1. Show interest in and value positively intercultural communication, identifying and analysing, in a guided way, the most common discriminations, prejudices and stereotypes in everyday and common situations..
6.2. Recognise and appreciate the linguistic and cultural diversity related to the foreign language, showing interest in knowing its elementary cultural and linguistic elements.
